title: Cannot compile Catch2 using GCC with -Werror -Wredundant-decls
body:
Consider the following CMake snippet:

```cmake
cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.11)

project(test-cmake-catch2)

add_compile_options(-Werror -Wredundant-decls)

include(FetchContent)

FetchContent_Declare(
  Catch2
  GIT_REPOSITORY https://github.com/catchorg/Catch2.git
  GIT_TAG        v3.3.2
)

FetchContent_MakeAvailable(Catch2)
```

If you try to build such CMake project as follows:
```sh
cmake -B build
cmake --build build --parallel
```

You would get warning treated as error:
```
In file included from build/_deps/catch2-src/src/catch2/catch_registry_hub.cpp:12:
build/_deps/catch2-src/src/catch2/../catch2/internal/catch_test_case_registry_impl.hpp:24:10: error: redundant redeclaration of ‘bool Catch::isThrowSafe(const TestCaseHandle&, const IConfig&)’ in same scope [-Werror=redundant-decls]
   24 |     bool isThrowSafe( TestCaseHandle const& testCase, IConfig const& config );
      |          ^~~~~~~~~~~
```

That's obviously can be easily fixed by the user of Catch2 by fixing CMake script. However, it could be non-trivial for large CMake scripts.

GCC version: 13.1.1 (this was also reproducible using GCC 12).

Possible workaround for users of Catch2:
```cmake
if(CMAKE_CXX_COMPILER_ID STREQUAL "GNU")
    target_compile_options(Catch2 PUBLIC -Wno-redundant-decls)
endif()
```

It would be nice to either fix these warnings in Catch2, or add above warning suppression into Catch2.
Another possible resolution: wontfix, and keep it in known-issues.
